<P>{@A@} 
.{%or%} (before vowels) AN: 
.²I This article | has no equiv. in Sanskrit and is expressed | by the singular number alone: 
.{%there is a | large silk-cotton tree on the banks of the Godavari%} | {#asti godAvarItIre viSAlaH SAlmalItaruH#} {@H.@} i.; 
.{%there | was a king named Cintamani%} {#aBUdrAjA cintAmaRi-#}|{#-rnAma#} Va. 
.²II But {#kaScit#} ({#kAcit, kiYcit#}) | should be added when special attention | is directed to the object: 
.{%a%} (certain) | 
.{%Yaksha%} {#kaScid yakzaH,#} Me. I 1.; 
.{%A%} (certain) | 
.{%saint named Marichi%} {#kaScinmarIcirnABa BaharziH,#} {@D.@} | iii. 
.²III When it means a species of, {#viSezaH, #}|{# BedaH,#} etc. should be added: 
.{%Asoka is a tree%} | {#aSoko vfkzaviSezaH.#} 
.²IV When used distribu-|-tively, (a) expr. by avy. comp. with {#prati,#} | 
.{%or,%} by the repetition of the word in proper | agreement with the verb: 
.{%give%} ({%me%}) 
.{%500 | sovereign a day%} {#pratyahaM suvarRapaYcaSatAni dehi,#} {@H.@} | iii; (b) the simple gen. may be used in | connection with num. adverbs: 
.{%dinner | twice a day%} {#dvirahno Bojanam,#} V. In {@O. E.@} some-|-times=on, in, for: q. v.: 
.{%the world runs | awheel%} {#*cakrErjagadDAvati.#}

<P>{@AS:@} 
.²I As a particle of comparison: 
.³1 | {#vat#} affixed, ({%he who looks on%}) 
.{%other's wives as%} | 
.{%mothers, on other's things as clods%} {#mAtfvat paradArezu #}|{# paradravyezu lozwravat,#} {@H.@} i.; 
.{%as before%} {#pUrvavat;#} 
.³2 {#yaTA#} | (either in comp. to expr. 
.{%sim. comparison, | or%} with {#taTA#} 
.{%or%} {#evaM#} to expr. 
.{%as......so......%} | also to introduce illustrations): 
.{%as ordered%} | {#yaTAnideSaM;#} 
.{%as prescribed%} {#yaTAviDi;#} 
.{%as before%} | {#yaTApurA,#} Sa. vi.; 
.{%as eating is inferred from | nourishment or country from its language, so is | knowable inferred from knowledge,%} {#yaTA puzwayA #}|{# BojanamanumIyate yaTA ca BAzayA deSaH taTA jYAnAkAreRa #}|{# jYeyamanumeyam.#} {@D.@} s. (see also R. iii. 23 and | notice the repetition of {#yaTA#} in such cases); | 
.{%as animals attempt to fly away when they see | men with sticks, so....%} {#yaTA paSvAdayaH daRqodyatakaraM #}|{# purUzamaBimuKamupalaBya palAyitumAraBante evaM..#} {@S.@} i. p.; | 
.{%as for instance, fire is inferred from smoke%} {#yaTA #}|{# DUmenAgniriti,#} N. d. 
.{%As for instance:%} sometimes | expr. by {#taTAhiH#} 
.{%he, as a rule, enjoyed the pleasures | of youth as for instance, sometimes roamed over | artificial mountains, sometimes walked through | summer houses%} {#sa prAyaSo yOvanasuKamanubaBUva, taTAhi #}|{# kadAcit krIqAparvatezu vicacAra kadAcillatAgfhezu baBrAma,#} | {@K. II.@} While: expr. by the pres. part: | 
.{%as he went, he thought%} {#vrajaMSca samarTayAmAsa,#} {@K. | III.@} Since, in as much as: q. v.: 
.³1 by the | abl. and when the subs. ends in {#tA#} 
.{%or%} {#A#} by | the ins.: 
.{%as the motion of the vessels%} ({%at sea%}) | 
.{%depends on wind%} {#vAtADInapotagamanatvAt,#} K. b.; | 
.{%as there was much political work%} {#rAjakAryasya #}|{# bahulatayA#} Sa. vi.; 
.³2 {#yataH...tataH..#} Miscell: | 
.{%as long as one lives%} {#yAvajjIvaM;#} 
.{%as far as the ocean%} | {#A samudrAt;#} 
.{%as high as the knee%} {#jAnudaGnaH#} ({#GnA, GnaM#}); | 
.{%as yet%} {#adyApi.#} N. B. 
.{%as,%} when it connects two | subs. s in apposition is expr. by {#BUtvA#} 
.{%or%} {#kftvA:#} |

<P>{@BE:@} 
.²I As a logical copula: 
.³1 {#Bavati#} ({#BU,#} | c. 1), 
.{%it is long-necked%} {#dIrDagrIvaH sa Bavati,#} U. | iv.; 
.{%the hearts of good men are always com-|-passionate%} {#karuRArdrARi satAM Kalu Bavanti sadA cetAMsi,#} | K. N. B. It is often understood: 
.{%the end of | aims is beyond comprehension%} {#duraGigamA hi gatiH #}|{# prayojanAnAm,#} Ki. x. 40. 
.²II Denoting existence, | presence: {#asti,#} 
.{%there was formerly a king | named S4udraka%} {#AsIdrAjA SUdrako nAma,#} K.; 
.{%and | there are heaps of gems%} {#santi ratnanicayASca BUriSaH,#} | Ki. xiii. 55. N. B. Note (a) that this verb is | exclusively used for 
.{%there is-, there was-,%} | etc.; (b) that in this sense, it is gen. | placed at the beginning of the sentence; | and (c) that this verb is defective and its | non-conjugational tenses are supplied by | those of {#BU#} and hence we meet with phrases | like {#aBUnnfpaH#} (-there was a king), B. i. 1.; | 
.³2 {#vartate, saM-,#} ({#vft,#} c. 1), 
.{%in a moment you will | be in your realm%} {#kzaRAt svAGikAraBUmO vartizyate,#} Sa. | vii.: v. To be present. Ph.: 
.{%here are | we%} {#ime smaH,#} Sa. iv.; 
.{%be it so%} {#evamastu, mavatu.#} 
.²III | To become: q. v.: {#Bavati.#}

.³1 {#iti;#} 
.{%poems are not good b. | old, nor faultly b. new%} {#purARamityeva na sADu sarvaM na #}|{# cApi kAvyaM navamityavadyam,#} Mal. I. N. B. Note the | position of {#iti;#} 
.³2 {#hi#} (never at the begin-|-ning of a sentence), 
.{%b. you see that a rich | man feels pain at the loss of his wealth%} ({%you | cannot conclude that%}) 
.{%he will have the same pain | when he assumes mendicancy%} {#na hi Danino DanApahA-#}|{#-ranimittaM duHKaM dfzwamiti tasyEva pravrajitasya tadeva duHKaM Bavati,#} | S. i. 4.: v. For. N. B. Observe that {#na hi#} is | the best way of expressing because...not. |

.{%or%} {#kasmAt#} (=why) with abl.: 
.{%here | the word%} {#Ayatana#}

.²I Assuredly: 
.³1 {#avaSyam#} (with-|-out failure), 
.{%what would c. take place%} {#avaSya-#}|{#-mBAvin#} (f. {#nI#}). H;

.{%would c. have victory%} {#DruvaM jayAH#} ({#Bavanti#}) (with | gen.), Ka. xv. 12,

.³4 {#asaMSayam:#} v. Undoub-|-tedly; 
.³5 {#niyatam#} (fixedly); 
.{%would c. give | permission%} {#niyatamanujYAsyati,#} D.; 
.³6 {#niScitam,#} N. [Page112] | com.

.{%‘I have much to ask about it.’ ‘Do so | calmly,’:%} {#‘bahu prazwavyamatra’ ¦ ‘viSrabDaM pfcCa,’#} Nu. iii.; | 
.{%address me as you have been accustomed to d.:%} | {#yaTAmyastamaBiDIyatAm,#} U. i.;

.²III As simple | auxiliary verb, not expressed: 
.{%sir, d. assist | me in trouble:%} {#klizwasya me kriyatAmarTasAhAyyakam,#} D. viii. | N. B. (a) When emphatic, expr. by words | given under truly, surly, indeed. (b) In | interrogative sentences, expr. by {#api, kaccit,#} | etc., 
.{%do you set to penances according to your capa-|-bility:%} {#api svaSattayA tapasi pravartase,#} Ku.

<P>{@FROM:@} 
.²I Of place: (a) by abl. 
.{%f. its top:%} | {#tasyAgraBAgAt,#} Sa.; 
.{%rose f. the seat:%} {#pIWAdudattizWat,#} | Si. i. 12.; (b) sometimes by tat. comp., | 
.{%fallen f. the mouth of a hawk:%} {#SyenamuKapariBrazwaH#} ({#zwA, #}|{# zwaM#}), K.

.{%the | village is a rojana f. the forest:%} {#vanAdgrAmo yojanam,#} | S. k.; 
.{%not far f. here:%} {#ito nAtidUre,#} K. 
.²III Of | time; (a) by abl. and {#praBfti#} 
.{%or%} {#AraBya,#} 
.{%f. the | time of seeing:%} {#darSanAt praBfti,#} K.; 
.{%f. today:%} {#adya-#}|{#-praBfti,#} Ki.; (b) by comp. with {#-avaDi#} 
.{%or%} {#A,#} | 
.{%f. today:%} {#adyAvaDi;#} 
.{%f. birth:%} {#AjanmanaH,#} Sa. v. 
.²IV | Of source, origin: (a) by abl., 
.{%the Ganges | rises f. the Himalayas:%} {#himavato gaNgA praBavati;#} 
.{%men | are sprung f. God:%} {#trahmaRaH prajAH prajAyante,#} S. k. 
.²V | Denoting cause, occasion, etc.: (a) by abl. | 
.{%not f. exhaustion:%} {#na KedAt,#} Mu. i.; 
.{%and f. non-|-perception of others:%} {#itarezAYcAnupalabDeH,#} S.; (b) by | ins. in the case of feminine nouns, 
.{%f. a | diesire to see:%} {#didfkzayA,#} Ki.: 
.{%f. fragrance:%} {#suraBitayA,#} | K. 
.²VI Of material: v. Of. 
.²VII Of | persons: expr. by {#sakASAt#} and gen., 
.{%f. Raghu:%} | {#roGoH sakASAt,#} R. v. 24. Miscell: 
.{%f. day to day.%} | {#dine dine,#} Ku. i. 25.: 
.{%f. country: to country:%} {#deSAt #}|{# deSam#} 
.{%or%} {#deSAntaram,#} D. vi.;

<P>{@HOW@} (adv.): 
.²I In what way: 
.³1 {#kaTam,#} 
.{%h. can a | servant be without fault:%} {#kaTaM nu dAso niraparADaH,#} | V.; 
.{%h.%} ({%you%}) 
.{%fell into the hands of the Chandal:%} | {#kaTaM caRqAlahastagamanam,#} K.;

.{%teach me | h. to make prostration:%} {#kena prakAreRa daRqapraRAmaH #}|{# kartavyastanmAM Sikzaya,#} V.t. N.B. 
.³1 In the last | sense, 
.{%h.%} is often not expr., 
.{%you know%} ({%h.%}) 
.{%to | make%} ({%one%}) 
.{%take:%} {#jAnAsi grAhayitum,#} K.; 
.³2 | sometimes expr. by {#kim#} (= what), 
.{%h. is%} | (= what has happened to) 
.{%Sa1garika1:%} | {#sAgarikAyAH kiM vartate,#} Ra. iv.

.{%h. many, h. long,%} etc.: | v. Many, long, etc.

.{%he%} according as the | noun for which it stands is in Sanskrit | n., m., or f.: 
.{%I have to say much about it:%} {#mama #}|{# bahvAKyeyamatra,#} Mr.; 
.{%what is it%} ({%you%})

.{%whether it%} ({#BARqakaH#}) 
.{%is the same or not:%} {#sa evEzA na #}|{# veti,#} Mr.; 
.{%therefore it%} ({#pfTvI#}) 
.{%looks even:%} {#ataH sA #}|{# samA pratiBAti,#} Go.; 
.{%its%} ({#maYjaryAH#}) 
.{%smell:%} {#asyA #}|{# ganDaH,#} K.; 
.{%is it true:%} {#api nAma satyam,#} Ma.; 
.{%it is | said in the Purana that the earth is even:%} {#purARe #}|{# BUH saBA kaTayate, No.;#}

.{%it%} is expr. in such cases.

<P>{@ON@} (prep.): 
.²I In contact with: 
.³1 by loc., | 
.{%lying on a grass bed:%} {#saMvizwaH kuSaSayane,#} R.; | 
.{%putting on his head:%} {#SirasyAropya;#} Vi.;

.{%to throw on | Vairodhaka:%} {#vEroDakasyopari nipAtanAya,#} Mu. N. B. | The ins. must be used after verbs of motion: | 
.{%to go on horse:%} {#aSvena gacCati,#} S.; 
.{%carrying on | his shoulders:%} {#skanDenodUhya,#} D.; 
.{%take me to%} ({%our%}) | 
.{%house on a fresh cloud:%} {#naya mAM navena vasatiM payomucA,#} | {@V. II.@} = at, near: 
.³1 by loc., 
.{%a cow-station | on the Ganges:%} {#gaNgAyAM GozaH,#} Kav.; 
.{%on the north:%} | {#uttarasyAM diSi,#} Ku.;

.{%on the following day:%} {#parasminnahani#} | (or commonly, {#paredyuH#}). 
.²IV = after: q.v.: | by loc. abs., 
.{%on her departure:%} {#gatAyAM tasyAm,#} {@K. | V.@} Denoting logical basis of connexion: | expr. by ins., 
.{%on one condition:%} {#ekenABisanDinA,#} | Sa.; 
.{%on oath:%} {#SapaTena#} (?). 
.²VI Concerning: | q.v.: expr. by comp., 
.{%a treatise on spheres:%} | {#golaprabanDaH,#} Go.

.²I In gen.: {#vA,#}

.{%is it a dream, an illusion, | or delusion of my mind:%} {#svapno nu mAyA nu matiBramo #}|{# nu,#} Sa.;

<P>{@SO@} (adv. conj.): 
.²I In gen: 
.³1 {#taTA,#} 
.{%as | Vishnu alone is known as the best of men, so the%} [Page657] | 
.{%sages know me%} ({%alone%}) 
.{%to be the performer of | hundred sacrifices:%} {#hariryaTEkaH puruzottamaH smftaH, taTA #}|{# vidurmAM munayaH Satakratum,#} R. iii. 49.; 
.{%not so much | before...as:%} {#taTA na pUrvaM...yaTA,#} Ki. viii. 41.; 
.{%so | scorched by the rays of the sun:%} {#taTAtitaptaM #}|{# saviturgaBastiBiH,#} Ku. v. 21.; 
.{%you should act so | that you are not laughed at by men:%} {#taTA prayateTA #}|{# yaTA nopahasyase janEH,#} K.; 
.{%let him be entirely so:%} | {#taTAviDastAvadaSezamastu saH,#} Ku. v. 82.; 
.{%be it so:%} | {#taTAstu,#} Pra. iii.; 
.³2 {#evam,#} 
.{%as sparks from | burning fire are scattered in every direction, so:%} | {#...yaTAgnerjvalataH sarvA diSo visPuliNgA vipratizWeran,#} | S. 10.; 
.{%and so of Vishnu:%} {#evaM hareSca,#} Li. 241.; | 
.{%my child, it is so or a%} ({%mere%}) 
.{%joke:%} {#ayIdamevaM #}|{# parihAso#} ({#vA#}), Ku. v. 62.; 
.{%don't say so:%} {#mA #}|{# mEvam,#} Mu. i.; 
.{%it is so, but...:%} {#evaBetat, kintu...,#} | Vi. 6.; 
.{%when the chief of divine sages said so%} | (i. e. as described above): {#evamuktavati devafzIndre,#} | N. v. 37.; 
.³3 {#tadvat#} (= in like manner: gen | with {#yadvat#}), S. iii. 3. 9. 
.²II Of degree: | expr. by words meaning such: 
.{%she is so | pretty:%} {#IdfSaM rUpalAvaRyam;#} 
.{%so excellent:%} {#IdfgguRopetaH#} | ({#tA, taM#}), Ki. xi. 41.; 
.{%so insufferable:%} {#IdfSaM #}|{# suduHsaham,#} Ki. i. 43.; 
.{%of so great-minded men:%} | {#tAdfSAnAM mahAtmanAm,#} K. N.B. 
.{%so great, so little,%} | is gen. expr. by sim. 
.{%such, his erudition is so | great:%} {#IdfSaM tasya pARqityam;#}

.{%or%} {#BadratayA#} | (= out of goodness); 
.{%ever so:%} v. However. |

.²III Conjunction, introduc-|-ing clauses or sentences as object of the | preceding verb.: 
.³1 expr. with {#iti,#} 
.{%would | think t. they adore him out of fear:%} {#maMsyati #}|{# BayAdarcanti mAmiti,#} Mah. v. 88. 3. (note the | use of direct speech);

.{%know-|-ing t. his end was born:%} {#jAnannapi jAtamantamAtmanaH,#} | Si. i. 67.;

.³3 with {#yaTA#} 
.{%or%} {#yat,#} | 
.{%Vas4ist2ha said t. they would go and live in the | hermitage of Va1lmi1ki:%} {#vaSizWasya vAcaH ‘yaTA vAlmIki-#}|{#-tapovanaM gatvA tatra vatsyAma iti’,#} U. ii.; 
.{%this is new | rule t. one repents after killing an enemy:%} {#ayaM #}|{# nUtano nyAyo yadarAtiM hatvA saMtApaH krIyate,#} H. ii. Ph.: | 
.{%granting t.%} expr. by: {#astu, stAm, santu.#} 
.²IV | Introducing reason etc.: (a) {%so t.:%} {#yaTA... #}|{# taTA,#} {%do so t. (he) hears from your messenger:%} | {#yaTA tava sandeSaharAcCfRoti taTA viDIyatAm,#} R. iii. 66.; | (b) {%in order t.:%} {#yaTA #}
.{#..taTA:#} v. also for (II), | to; (c) in t.= because: q. v. Ph.: {%oh | that:%} expr. with {#kaccit:#} v. To wish.
